COMMENT_TX: Meusel leaned over the bleacher rail to pull it down
Start of the game delayed 45 minutes due to rain
Texas Leaguer fell between Peck, McNeely, and Goslin
It was clouding up again very threateningly as Goslin went to bat for the 2nd time in the inning.
Over Harris; it was difficult to follow the flight of the ball from the stands due to the darkness.
Game  called on account of darkness.
During Coveleski's AB, time was taken to attend to O'Neill's finger hurt by a foul tip.  Covey swung at next pitch for strike three.
Spectacular catch, taking the ball off the concrete railing and tumbling over into a lower box.
McNally hesitated about trapping Dugan then threw late to 1B
Paschal misjudged it and slipped on the running track

Deep into RF bleachers With a 2-2 count Shawkey thought he threw strike three, but Ump Nallin called it ball three.  Yankee infielders all rushed the umpire to argue.  Mgr Huggins came out to prevent his players from saying anything too violent.  The game was delayed about five minutes by the squabble. Judge hit next pitch out.

Harris jumped up and began to swap opinions with Scotty on the manner in which the ball had been applied to his anatomy. Both benches cleared to prevent them from fighting. W.Post claimed it was Scott who objected to Harris's slide.
Into LF wing of the pavilion
Close decision at the plate; Huggins argued
Into LF wing of the lower pavilion, just fair
Fine running catch over his shoulder
Lamar had a pulled leg muscle
Texas Leaguer 'fell among a convention of Yankees'

The return throw home had Simmons beat but Ump Connolly ruled O'Neill missed the tag.  According to NYT, Simmons slid away from the baseline and never came near the plate. 'The fact was obvious to everybody in the park except for Mr. Connolly, who formed a minority of one in favor of the runner.'
pbp account ends here, rest deduced
Into RF bleachers; NYT: 'a glorified pop fly'
Pipp beat Galloway's throw to 3B; evasive slide
After Harriss escaped trouble, the joyous A's bench ran out to escort him back to the dugout.
Into RF bleachers, a foot inside the foul line
$Stole while Shocker was fondling the ball

$Everett Scott out of game for first time since June, 1916 after 1,307 consecutive games (the record at the time). One report said it was illness that kept him out; another declared Huggins benched him because of his slow fielding and poor hitting.  PDL: It was said after the game that Huggins promised to put him back at shortstop if they had scored a run or two in the 7th.
Ehmke slipped trying to field the ball
Williams lost it in the sun; it almost hit him in the head
Spectacular 1-handed catch diving among the bats in front of the Yankee dugout.
Great stop of hot grounder over 2B
Long fly that rolled to LCF bleachers.  Meusel crossed the plate standing up.
Ran over to the boxes and leaned over to make the catch
1-handed catch by Pipp of high throw saved an E6
$BOUNCE HR to deep LF, bounding into the pavilion
Bounced a hard hit over Wanninger
Caromed off Wingfield's glove to Wamby
Would've been a single but Wamby forgot to cover 2B
Terrific drive past the running track in LCF
Into LF wing of the pavilion
Great try but popped out of Wamby's glove
Shawkey & Dugan lost it in sun
Prothro hurt his ankle hooking into the bag
NYT: Paschal tried gallantly for a fly Combs should've had
Pretty catch in front of NYA dugout
pbp account ended here, rest deduced
Attempted SH drew Pipp off 1B leaving it uncovered
Past the running track to the LF bleachers; Goslin tripped rounding 1B or else would've had a homer.
Hit over Rice past the running track.  Ruth threw himself headlong towards the plate in a long slide when his weary legs failed him.
Pretty catch off the grandstand screen
Ruth was cheered as he ran in a short distance for his first putout of the season.
Ruth in and Ward out; they both hesitated and it fell in
Running, leaping, tumbling, 1-handed circus catch; Ruth was wildly cheered.
Into RF bleachers; NYT: RCF bleachers
Great slide stretched it to a double
Attempted force on high bounder but Peck beat throw
Soared over J.Harris to RF bleachers
Thunderous clout to LCF landed on the running track and bounced to the fence.  He scored without a slide.

$NYT: Miller Huggins took his favorite lineup and shook it to pieces.  Wally Pipp, after more than 10 years as regular first baseman, was benched in favor of Lou Gehrig, former Columbia U. fence-wrecker.
Over the shoulder catch on the terrace
Beautiful throw retired the diving Wanninger
Hoyt let Meusel's throw-in escape him and roll to pavilion
Wonderful backhand running catch robbed Gehrig
It was after 6:15pm; the shades of night were falling fast
Into LF bleachers; Meusel was met by a mob of fans as he trotted over the plate, and was given a big reception as he fought his way to the dugout.
Bengough dropped the incoming throw but no error charged
Ruth was slow going after the ball in the sun
Hit his elbow then bounced off his skull, knocking him down
NYEW: Hit in stomach NYT: Hit over the heart and sank to the ground registering pain and clutching spasmodically.
Nice play by Judge taking the errant throw and tagging Pee-Wee with a lightning thrust on the shoulder.
Sisler given a hand as he came to bat
Over Rice to deep RCF, beating the relay throw; his 1st/only ML HR.
Nearly to the flagpole; Gehrig's 1st ML HR
Dugan ducked to get out of the way of the mean bounder
$Shocker affected by the heat; great round of cheers for him
Browns argued it was foul and Ump Hildebrand agreed, but Ump Evans disallowed it and ordered Sisler and his men back into their positions.  Play resumed after several minutes' delay.
Bush got a welcoming hand as he came to the plate

$Spectacular pickup of short bounder and threw him out with the same motion.  Dugan fell as he completed the throw and half-limped, half-staggered up and collapsed on the grass just outside the foul line.  His collapsible knee was thought to have gone bad on him.  He laid on the grass apparently unconscious as hundreds of fans liberated by the end of the game crowded about and were kept back with difficulty by the other players.  He was fanned and revived, then carried off the field on the shoulders of his mates.
Beautiful 1-handed running catch robbed Ward of a triple

After Rice caught short fly, Combs ran a few feet down the line and stopped when Rice faked a throw.  Combs edged further along and Rice again feigned a toss.  When Combs was almost half way to the plate, he broke for home, causing the surprised Rice to make a bad throw to Severeid. Combs scored standing up.
$Before the game a Peerless auto was driven to the Yankee dugout and presented to Bob Shawkey by his loving fans.
Gehrig may have missed the squeeze signal
Bounced up Wanninger's arm and rolled behind him; his throw home was late.

$As an attempted double steal was started, Schang bluffed a throw to 2B then threw to 3B, trapping McNulty.  During the run down between 3B & home, Shanks dropped an easy toss from Schang.  DWS: No CS in 1925 since runner safe on error
Combs surprised Speaker and made 2B by a long, pretty slide
Ward juggled the ball which prevented the FO
Dugan protested Ump Hildebrand's call at 1B
Into RF bleachers; he was loudly applauded

CPD/NYEW: Backward running catch; Ruth fell on the terrace and rolled over, but held on. NYT: 'Babe rushed back to the grassy slope, but fell flat. While reclining like a Roman Emperor he reached up and dragged the ball out of the ozone.'
Ruth & Combs did a modified Alphonse & Gaston
To the running track; another case of the hesitation glide by Combs & Ruth.
Into RF bleachers near foul line
Towering fly landed behind Lutzke who lost it in the sun
To deep LCF; scored standing up
Dropped it near the running track after a run
Uhle kicked the high bounder with his knees past Knode
Good throw by Jamieson held Wanninger
$Attempted double steal as Ruth fanned.  Wanninger scored on Sewell's low return throw home; DWS: no CS in 1925 because runner safe on error
Speaker made another of his sliding shoestring catches and robbed Hoyt.
Smashing grounder caromed off Wanninger to Ward
Misjudged the liner and dropped it
Low liner to CF bleachers; fast sprinting beat relay throw
$Fred Merkle signed on as Yankee coach and appeared on the lines in today's game.
Titanic swat to the edge of the bleachers in RCF at the angle where the fences meet.  Cobb dragged it down.
Cobb lost it in the sun, overran it, and it bounced out of his glove and over his head.
Into RF bleachers; line drive over the upper corner of the exit gate, a few feet to the right and almost half way up the terrace.
Ruth was going full tilt toward the line while Gehrig was rushing at him from the opposite direction.
No throw; Tigers caught by surprise
Pennock's hurried throw landed against the grandstand back of 1B.  Blue stopped at 3B but Gehrig threw unnecessarily and wildly over Bengough.  Pennock failed to backup.
Hoyt threw high and into the path of Fothergill who bumped Gehrig at the bag.

Ward forced Gehrig at 2B; Gehrig broke up the DP attempt, but Tigers claimed he went into O'Rourke so hard that he interfered with the attempted DP throw.  After some debate by the umpires, Gehrig was declared out for interference. Fans applauded the decision and booed Gehrig.
Shanks, Wanninger, and Shawkey all tried for the pop fly; there was a collision and the ball dropped through Shanks' hands. Shawkey was spiked when Shanks ran into him.
Good try but Ruth couldn't hold it
1st out of inning after 14 consecutive batters reached
18 Tigers batted in 6th; half-inning lasted 49 minutes
Shocker's first appearance in 10 days; a bandage was still on his left hand.
Heilmann pulled a charley horse and limped around the bases
Yankees claimed Wells balked after moving his left hand. Umps consulted and agreed.
Pretty catch; Ruth picked it off RF screen
Combs dropped the fly but got the force
Collins cheered as he went to bat
Cvengros was slightly spiked in the feet by Combs at the plate when he tried to take Schalk's throw.
Great running catch saved a triple
Ward spiked Sheely's foot returning to 1B, cutting through the shoe.
Meusel lost the ball in the sun
Ward was running on the pitch

Ward lost short liner in sun but Paschal scooped it up and whipped it home. NYT reported Huggins gave orders to walk Schalk, but Ray 'reached over his head for Pennock's first pitch and dropped it into RF...Falk, as well as the Yankees, was taken by surprise and Paschal's good throw...cut him down by a close margin'. CDT: because Ray had knocked the cover off the ball in the 9th, Pennock decided to walk him.  The first pitch was wide and high.  Falk saw what was being done and turned back to 2B, but Schalk reached way out and poked it into RF.  Falk's poor jump proved costly.
Falk fielded it and winged it home but Pennock slid safely.
High bound over Combs and rolled to CF bleachers
Torrid single past Collins into RCF
Through Sheely.  Ruth made 3B by great effort tumbling into the bag on his hands & knees.
Sensational catch colliding with the iron rail at the end of the Yankee dugout and turning a complete somersault.
Davis heaved it to the pavilion
Missed GDP but got Gehrig at the plate.
Dropped it after a hard run
One of the longest singles of the season

During batting practice Wally Pipp was struck above the right ear by a pitch thrown by Charlie Caldwell, rendering him unconscious.  He staggered for a few moments and fell. He was carried to the clubhouse and regained consciousness within a few minutes, but shortly after again became insensible.  He suffered from violent nausea but no bleeding (as was the case with Ray Chapman).  Pipp was taken to St. Vincent Hospital where he recovered quickly.
Rommel beat Combs to the bag; no SH so possible drag bunt
Hoyt looked at 3B then 2B before finally throwing to 1B.  As soon as Hoyt turned away from 3B Miller raced home and scored about the time the ball got to 1B.
Miller must've thought the ball would be caught in the air because he clung to 1B.  If Gehrig had tagged him first before touching the bag, it would've been a DP.
Over RF wall; it landed on a hand rail of the bleacher exit in RF and hopped down the stairs and out of sight.
Meusel hit the first pitch toward LF stands but it curved foul, missing the fair zone 'by the span of a flea's ankle'.
Great stop; threw to 1B from a sitting position
Schang caught a fast-breaking curve on his bare hand which bruised his fingers badly.
Neat running catch of low liner
Close play at plate; great sprint and slide by Ruth
Wanninger's high throw to 1B lost a DP
Lamar collided with Simmons going after the fly; they exchanged looks and Simmons sat down suddenly.
Bounced a curve beside home plate
Mile-high pop fly back of the pitcher's box

PDL: Dykes slashed the ball through Gehrig and was sitting on 1B when Pennock caught Gehrig's toss.  Ump Owens was standing right there and when he said 'Out,' even Connie Mack gave him the razzberry.
Struck out on three large swings
Witt was supposed to have been released by NYA this morning
Veach entered after Ward bunted foul on the squeeze play. The 1B coach ran to 2B to talk to Meusel.
Poole caught it halfway to the plate
Veach misjudged it and fell.  His throw got past Dugan but Joe pounced on it and threw home in time.
Cochrane's throw pulled Galloway across 2B; no throw home
Over Meusel to LCF fence; scored one stride ahead of throw
Scott applauded by crowd as he came to bat
Scott knocked it down but had no play

$BOUNCE HR; hopped into the pavilion on the first bound. NYT: Slapped a high drive into LF close to the line.  Goslin and Scott raced toward it which looked as if it was going to drop into the foul territory of the open stand.  But it was fair by a couple of feet, bounded high off the sun-baked ground, and hopped into the stand. W.Post: Ordinary fly; Goslin misjudged it after a long run and had to let it drop, but it bounced sharply into the stands.  Lucky HR.
When Harris overthrew 1B, Combs tried for 2B
Bennett started in RF due to injury to Williams who hit his arm against a door in the train as it left Pittsburgh.
Diving attempt by Paschal but it bounded past him

High up and far away into RF bleachers.  Harry Rice stood stock still and surveyed it passing over his head like a puzzled citizen watching the flight of the Shenandoah.  He saw it but didn't know what to do about it.
Spectacular catch leaning over the pavilion seats to pick it off the straw hat of one of the spectators.
Sisler out with inflamed left leg; left this evening on train for Ohio because of mother's death. Ken Williams out with neuritis in his arm.
To the deep corner in LCF
Giard ran to 3B line and tagged Ward
Texas Leaguer; Meusel didn't get a good jump on it

Combs could've easily made 2B but Rice appeared to get in his way and threw him out of his stride.  Coach O'Leary and the rest of the Yankees protested; all three umpires were consulted but none had seen the interference.
Bennett lost high fly in the sun and it dropped at his feet
Picked it off the Yankee dugout roof
Great running catch past the cinder track robbed Ruth
High tricky bounder that Wanninger could barely knock down
Gehrig's dash ended with a head-first slide under Hargrave
Speaker was applauded as he came to bat
Throw got away from L.Sewell when Combs bowled him over
High bounder to the box; extremely close play at the plate
Speaker nearly caught it at the wire screen
During this AB Myatt disappeared into the NYA dugout trying to catch Sewell's foul.
Hopped into a field box after rolling foul past 3B
Infield hit; high hopper over the box
During this AB Shawkey fouled twice trying to sacrifice

Shanks went to 3B on hit, Bengough to 2B on throw.  While Fewster argued the call at 2B with Ump Dinneen, Shanks walked half way home then made a dash for it.  Myatt picked Fewster's hurried throw out of the dirt and tagged Shanks sliding in.
During this AB Gehrig went head-first into a field box going after Lutzke's foul.
McNulty grabbed it right out of Speaker's glove
Speaker snuck in as Bengough overran 2B
Buckeye ran the ball to 1B for the unassisted DP.
Meusel bluffed throw to 3B then whipped to 2B to catch Lee rounding the bag a bit too far.
Ward out with badly swollen left thumb injured on Monday
Too hot for Shanks; caromed over toward 2B

NYT: Infield hit to 3B; Johnson noticed Myatt had turned toward 2B after crossing the bag and whipped the ball to Gehrig. NYEW/CPD: S.BX2(3) -- the low throw (from unknown position) escaped Gehrig who recovered and tagged Myatt as he turned to run to 2B.
Hard bounder hopped past Fewster into RCF
Nice pickup by Wanninger; Gehrig dug throw out of the dirt
NYEW: Wells looked toward the bench on numerous occasions during the game as if beseeching aid while getting heavily hammered by the Yankee batters.
Lucky triple; O'Rourke kicked it into foul territory
Pipp's first appearance since being hit by a ball in practice on July 2nd.

During the game Ty Cobb paid a short visit to 1B coaching box where he tried to rattle Gehrig, accusing him by panto- mime of trying to walk all over his players' feet at 1B. When Gehrig ignored him Cobb turned around and tried to tell the spectactors back of 1B about it; he took a good-natured joshing with a smile.
Hit on the left arm and ribs, knocking him down.  Trainer Doc Woods gave him aid.
Running catch in front of NYA dugout
Cobb tripped/fell rounding 1B, costing him a double
Picked it off the pavilion screen
Knocked it down; threw him out from deep SS
Leaping bare-handed catch against RF screen
Manush ran home after the catch but the run was disallowed when it was ruled he left early.
Manush dropped it after a long run but no error charged

NYTEM: Shawkey noticed Cobb had a big lead off 1B and dashed over with the ball to try to make the tag himself.  But Cobb got back to 1B safely and had the last laugh on Shawkey when Burke legged it to 3B during the play. NYT: While Gehrig and Cobb were chatting at 1B, Shawkey tried to sneak over and catch Tyrus off the base, but he was a bit late.  Burke stole 3B on the bold attempt.
It dropped just back of Johnson
Yankees argued Hooper was out at the plate

With Bengough up, Lyons' PO2 attempt hit Gehrig on the head as he dove head-first back into 2B.  Lou took the count but soon came around after inhaling deeply from smelling salts and stayed in the game.
Veach backed up on the terrace
Infield hit; slow bounder over Shawkey
Vache let it get by him
Bischoff made a poor throw to Prothro
Nice running catch of Texas Leaguer
Texas Leaguer just out of Wanninger's reach
Johnson's throw to 1B was wide by 10' but Bengough backed up
Tried advancing on a short passed ball

During Johnson's AB an attempted SH was turned into a DP by Cochrane, Galloway, and Holt.  Yankees protested to Ump Hildebrand that it was foul.  When Ump Geisel was consulted (from 2B) the call was overturned.  Johnson then singled.
ej,shocu101,P,hildg101,'Balls and strikes' Urban Shocker ejected by HP umpire George Hildebrand
High throw to plate; Bengough jumped to catch it and tagged Foxx who did not attempt to slide.
Bounced off Gehrig's glove; good base-running
Fly fell between Combs and Paschal
Glanced off Pennock's glove to Koenig
Dixon backed up the play and caught Combs away from the bag
Into LF stands, over the leaping Bennett
Into RF bleachers, just beyond Ruth's reach
Far into RF bleachers, up above the exit gate
Bounce HR into pavilion on the first bound
Threw to the pavilion as no one covered 3B.
In mid-delivery Johnson's front foot slipped and he fell
Combs ran to 3B after the throw; made it by a great slide
Hit Gerber's shoe and bounded high in the air
NYTEM coverage ended here, rest deduced
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Running catch at the running track

'...one of the longest drives ever seen at the Stadium or any other park and any league.  To be exact, the horsehide hit the LF bleachers on the first hop.  It is estimated that if Paschal had turned on the ball and driven it to RF, the pill would have gone clear over the subway tracks.' Paschal scored by a great burst of speed.
Paschal aggravated an old foot injury during IPHR
Into the left wing of the pavilion
Combs did not run at full speed nor slide away from Schalk
$Faber's arm was so painfully bruised that he had to leave
Into RF bleachers; Ruth had to fight his way through a cheering mob before he touched the plate.
NYT: 'over the head of Ruth who was slow and elephantine'
Into RF bleachers to the left of the exit gate
Manush tried for a shoestring catch
Bassler injured finger from foul tip
Shanks' throw to 1B hit Tavener on the head
High up into the RF bleachers about a dozen rows from the the top, way out beyond the exit runway.  Ruth's longest of the season, and one of the huskiest of his career.
Wingo lost it in the sun
Over Fothergill; Ruth and Meusel tumbled into the plate almost at each other's heels. Bassler missed Ruth but nabbed Meusel on a close touch.
Into LF bleachers; Doyle's 1st career HR
Into LF bleachers; Doyle's 2nd (and last) career HR
Bounder hit Koenig in the stomach

Close play at home; splendid throw by Lamar but Perkins missed a stab at Durocher.

Into RF bleachers; line drive over the upper corner of the exit gate, a few feet to the right and almost half way up the terrace.
Ruth was going full tilt toward the line while Gehrig was rushing at him from the opposite direction.
No throw; Tigers caught by surprise
Pennock's hurried throw landed against the grandstand back of 1B.  Blue stopped at 3B but Gehrig threw unnecessarily and wildly over Bengough.  Pennock failed to backup.
Hoyt threw high and into the path of Fothergill who bumped Gehrig at the bag.

Ward forced Gehrig at 2B; Gehrig broke up the DP attempt, but Tigers claimed he went into O'Rourke so hard that he interfered with the attempted DP throw.  After some debate by the umpires, Gehrig was declared out for interference. Fans applauded the decision and booed Gehrig.
Shanks, Wanninger, and Shawkey all tried for the pop fly; there was a collision and the ball dropped through Shanks' hands. Shawkey was spiked when Shanks ran into him.
Good try but Ruth couldn't hold it
1st out of inning after 14 consecutive batters reached
18 Tigers batted in 6th; half-inning lasted 49 minutes
Shocker's first appearance in 10 days; a bandage was still on his left hand.
Heilmann pulled a charley horse and limped around the bases
Yankees claimed Wells balked after moving his left hand. Umps consulted and agreed.
Pretty catch; Ruth picked it off RF screen
Combs dropped the fly but got the force
Collins cheered as he went to bat
Cvengros was slightly spiked in the feet by Combs at the plate when he tried to take Schalk's throw.
Great running catch saved a triple
Ward spiked Sheely's foot returning to 1B, cutting through the shoe.
Meusel lost the ball in the sun
Ward was running on the pitch

Ward lost short liner in sun but Paschal scooped it up and whipped it home. NYT reported Huggins gave orders to walk Schalk, but Ray 'reached over his head for Pennock's first pitch and dropped it into RF...Falk, as well as the Yankees, was taken by surprise and Paschal's good throw...cut him down by a close margin'. CDT: because Ray had knocked the cover off the ball in the 9th, Pennock decided to walk him.  The first pitch was wide and high.  Falk saw what was being done and turned back to 2B, but Schalk reached way out and poked it into RF.  Falk's poor jump proved costly.
Falk fielded it and winged it home but Pennock slid safely.
High bound over Combs and rolled to CF bleachers
Torrid single past Collins into RCF
Through Sheely.  Ruth made 3B by great effort tumbling into the bag on his hands & knees.
Sensational catch colliding with the iron rail at the end of the Yankee dugout and turning a complete somersault.
Davis heaved it to the pavilion
Missed GDP but got Gehrig at the plate.
Dropped it after a hard run
One of the longest singles of the season

During batting practice Wally Pipp was struck above the right ear by a pitch thrown by Charlie Caldwell, rendering him unconscious.  He staggered for a few moments and fell. He was carried to the clubhouse and regained consciousness within a few minutes, but shortly after again became insensible.  He suffered from violent nausea but no bleeding (as was the case with Ray Chapman).  Pipp was taken to St. Vincent Hospital where he recovered quickly.
Rommel beat Combs to the bag; no SH so possible drag bunt
Hoyt looked at 3B then 2B before finally throwing to 1B.  As soon as Hoyt turned away from 3B Miller raced home and scored about the time the ball got to 1B.
Miller must've thought the ball would be caught in the air because he clung to 1B.  If Gehrig had tagged him first before touching the bag, it would've been a DP.
Over RF wall; it landed on a hand rail of the bleacher exit in RF and hopped down the stairs and out of sight.
Meusel hit the first pitch toward LF stands but it curved foul, missing the fair zone 'by the span of a flea's ankle'.
Great stop; threw to 1B from a sitting position
Schang caught a fast-breaking curve on his bare hand which bruised his fingers badly.
Neat running catch of low liner
Close play at plate; great sprint and slide by Ruth
Wanninger's high throw to 1B lost a DP
Lamar collided with Simmons going after the fly; they exchanged looks and Simmons sat down suddenly.
Bounced a curve beside home plate
Mile-high pop fly back of the pitcher's box

PDL: Dykes slashed the ball through Gehrig and was sitting on 1B when Pennock caught Gehrig's toss.  Ump Owens was standing right there and when he said 'Out,' even Connie Mack gave him the razzberry.
Struck out on three large swings
Witt was supposed to have been released by NYA this morning
Veach entered after Ward bunted foul on the squeeze play. The 1B coach ran to 2B to talk to Meusel.
Poole caught it halfway to the plate
Veach misjudged it and fell.  His throw got past Dugan but Joe pounced on it and threw home in time.
Cochrane's throw pulled Galloway across 2B; no throw home
Over Meusel to LCF fence; scored one stride ahead of throw
Scott applauded by crowd as he came to bat
Scott knocked it down but had no play

$BOUNCE HR; hopped into the pavilion on the first bound. NYT: Slapped a high drive into LF close to the line.  Goslin and Scott raced toward it which looked as if it was going to drop into the foul territory of the open stand.  But it was fair by a couple of feet, bounded high off the sun-baked ground, and hopped into the stand. W.Post: Ordinary fly; Goslin misjudged it after a long run and had to let it drop, but it bounced sharply into the stands.  Lucky HR.
When Harris overthrew 1B, Combs tried for 2B
Bennett started in RF due to injury to Williams who hit his arm against a door in the train as it left Pittsburgh.
Diving attempt by Paschal but it bounded past him

High up and far away into RF bleachers.  Harry Rice stood stock still and surveyed it passing over his head like a puzzled citizen watching the flight of the Shenandoah.  He saw it but didn't know what to do about it.
Spectacular catch leaning over the pavilion seats to pick it off the straw hat of one of the spectators.
Sisler out with inflamed left leg; left this evening on train for Ohio because of mother's death. Ken Williams out with neuritis in his arm.
To the deep corner in LCF
Giard ran to 3B line and tagged Ward
Texas Leaguer; Meusel didn't get a good jump on it

Combs could've easily made 2B but Rice appeared to get in his way and threw him out of his stride.  Coach O'Leary and the rest of the Yankees protested; all three umpires were consulted but none had seen the interference.
Bennett lost high fly in the sun and it dropped at his feet
Picked it off the Yankee dugout roof
Great running catch past the cinder track robbed Ruth
High tricky bounder that Wanninger could barely knock down
Gehrig's dash ended with a head-first slide under Hargrave
Speaker was applauded as he came to bat
Throw got away from L.Sewell when Combs bowled him over
High bounder to the box; extremely close play at the plate
Speaker nearly caught it at the wire screen
During this AB Myatt disappeared into the NYA dugout trying to catch Sewell's foul.
Hopped into a field box after rolling foul past 3B
Infield hit; high hopper over the box
During this AB Shawkey fouled twice trying to sacrifice

Shanks went to 3B on hit, Bengough to 2B on throw.  While Fewster argued the call at 2B with Ump Dinneen, Shanks walked half way home then made a dash for it.  Myatt picked Fewster's hurried throw out of the dirt and tagged Shanks sliding in.
During this AB Gehrig went head-first into a field box going after Lutzke's foul.
McNulty grabbed it right out of Speaker's glove
Speaker snuck in as Bengough overran 2B
Buckeye ran the ball to 1B for the unassisted DP.
Meusel bluffed throw to 3B then whipped to 2B to catch Lee rounding the bag a bit too far.
Ward out with badly swollen left thumb injured on Monday
Too hot for Shanks; caromed over toward 2B

NYT: Infield hit to 3B; Johnson noticed Myatt had turned toward 2B after crossing the bag and whipped the ball to Gehrig. NYEW/CPD: S.BX2(3) -- the low throw (from unknown position) escaped Gehrig who recovered and tagged Myatt as he turned to run to 2B.
Hard bounder hopped past Fewster into RCF
Nice pickup by Wanninger; Gehrig dug throw out of the dirt
NYEW: Wells looked toward the bench on numerous occasions during the game as if beseeching aid while getting heavily hammered by the Yankee batters.
Lucky triple; O'Rourke kicked it into foul territory
Pipp's first appearance since being hit by a ball in practice on July 2nd.

During the game Ty Cobb paid a short visit to 1B coaching box where he tried to rattle Gehrig, accusing him by panto- mime of trying to walk all over his players' feet at 1B. When Gehrig ignored him Cobb turned around and tried to tell the spectactors back of 1B about it; he took a good-natured joshing with a smile.
Hit on the left arm and ribs, knocking him down.  Trainer Doc Woods gave him aid.
Running catch in front of NYA dugout
Cobb tripped/fell rounding 1B, costing him a double
Picked it off the pavilion screen
Knocked it down; threw him out from deep SS
Leaping bare-handed catch against RF screen
Manush ran home after the catch but the run was disallowed when it was ruled he left early.
Manush dropped it after a long run but no error charged

NYTEM: Shawkey noticed Cobb had a big lead off 1B and dashed over with the ball to try to make the tag himself.  But Cobb got back to 1B safely and had the last laugh on Shawkey when Burke legged it to 3B during the play. NYT: While Gehrig and Cobb were chatting at 1B, Shawkey tried to sneak over and catch Tyrus off the base, but he was a bit late.  Burke stole 3B on the bold attempt.
It dropped just back of Johnson
Yankees argued Hooper was out at the plate

With Bengough up, Lyons' PO2 attempt hit Gehrig on the head as he dove head-first back into 2B.  Lou took the count but soon came around after inhaling deeply from smelling salts and stayed in the game.
Veach backed up on the terrace
Infield hit; slow bounder over Shawkey
Vache let it get by him
Bischoff made a poor throw to Prothro
Nice running catch of Texas Leaguer
Texas Leaguer just out of Wanninger's reach
Johnson's throw to 1B was wide by 10' but Bengough backed up
Tried advancing on a short passed ball

During Johnson's AB an attempted SH was turned into a DP by Cochrane, Galloway, and Holt.  Yankees protested to Ump Hildebrand that it was foul.  When Ump Geisel was consulted (from 2B) the call was overturned.  Johnson then singled.
ej,shocu101,P,hildg101,'Balls and strikes' Urban Shocker ejected by HP umpire George Hildebrand
High throw to plate; Bengough jumped to catch it and tagged Foxx who did not attempt to slide.
Bounced off Gehrig's glove; good base-running
Fly fell between Combs and Paschal
Glanced off Pennock's glove to Koenig
Dixon backed up the play and caught Combs away from the bag
Into LF stands, over the leaping Bennett
Into RF bleachers, just beyond Ruth's reach
Far into RF bleachers, up above the exit gate
Bounce HR into pavilion on the first bound
Threw to the pavilion as no one covered 3B.
In mid-delivery Johnson's front foot slipped and he fell
Combs ran to 3B after the throw; made it by a great slide
Hit Gerber's shoe and bounded high in the air
NYTEM coverage ended here, rest deduced
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Running catch at the running track

'...one of the longest drives ever seen at the Stadium or any other park and any league.  To be exact, the horsehide hit the LF bleachers on the first hop.  It is estimated that if Paschal had turned on the ball and driven it to RF, the pill would have gone clear over the subway tracks.' Paschal scored by a great burst of speed.
Paschal aggravated an old foot injury during IPHR
Into the left wing of the pavilion
Combs did not run at full speed nor slide away from Schalk
$Faber's arm was so painfully bruised that he had to leave
Into RF bleachers; Ruth had to fight his way through a cheering mob before he touched the plate.
NYT: 'over the head of Ruth who was slow and elephantine'
Into RF bleachers to the left of the exit gate
Manush tried for a shoestring catch
Bassler injured finger from foul tip
Shanks' throw to 1B hit Tavener on the head
High up into the RF bleachers about a dozen rows from the the top, way out beyond the exit runway.  Ruth's longest of the season, and one of the huskiest of his career.
Wingo lost it in the sun
Over Fothergill; Ruth and Meusel tumbled into the plate almost at each other's heels. Bassler missed Ruth but nabbed Meusel on a close touch.
Into LF bleachers; Doyle's 1st career HR
Into LF bleachers; Doyle's 2nd (and last) career HR
Bounder hit Koenig in the stomach
Bounder caromed off Dykes' knee toward the pavilion
Close play at home; splendid throw by Lamar but Perkins missed a stab at Durocher.
PDL: Combs rounded 3B; when he drew a throw from Holt to Dykes he took off for home, just making it after a big burst of speed and fancy slide.
